meanings.definition: Capable of being violated or transgressed.
meanings.sent1: The fragile lock was violable by a simple twist of the key.
meanings.sent2: The rules of the game were violable if all players agreed to change them.
meanings.sent3: The 'Do Not Enter' sign seemed to mockingly dare people to cross, as if it knew it was violable.
meanings.sent4: Her trust was like a violable fortress, easily breached by deceitful words.
meanings.sent5: The ancient curse was as violable as a thin sheet of ice, waiting to be shattered by a single misstep.

meanings.definition: Able to be broken or disregarded.
meanings.sent1: The delicate glass ornaments were violable with just a slight bump.
meanings.sent2: The contract was violable if either party failed to fulfill their obligations.
meanings.sent3: The 'No Trespassing' sign was so faded that it appeared almost violable.
meanings.sent4: His resolve was as violable as a sandcastle against the incoming tide.
meanings.sent5: The ancient seal on the tomb was violable, allowing the archaeologists to uncover its secrets.

meanings.sent1: The privacy of their home felt violable with the windows left open.
meanings.sent2: The fragile peace treaty was violable if any nation decided to break it.
meanings.sent3: The 'Keep Out' sign looked so old and worn that it seemed almost violable.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was as violable as a fragile glass bauble, easily shattered by harsh words.
meanings.sent5: The ancient spell protecting the treasure was violable, and the adventurers knew they had a chance to claim it.
